business.headline: Wall Street bounces back after wild week fueled by tariff warAll three major US indexes ended the session sharply higher after assurances from Boston Federal Reserve President Susan Collins that the Fed is prepared to keep financial markets functioning should the need arise.

India pushing for trade deals with US, EU with high urgency: JaishankarOn Wednesday, Trump announced a 90-day pause on his sweeping tariffs on all countries, except China as countries around the world wilted under the impact of the seismic action.

How Trump tariffs could make iPhones, cars, and clothes costlier in the USTrump's latest plan includes a massive 145% tax on goods coming from China. Experts say this could end the long run of cheap, imported goods that Americans have enjoyed for decades.
Sensex ends 1,300 points higher, Nifty above 22,500; Tata Steel up 5%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,310.11 points to close at 75,157.26, while the NSE Nifty50 added 429.40 points to end at 22,828.55.

Mutual fund SIP vs PPF: What Rs 1 lakh a year can earn in 15 yearsPPF is a government scheme with a current interest rate of around 7.1% per annum. On the other hand, SIPs typically offer higher interest when invested over the long term, especially in equity mutual funds. But they carry some risk, as returns depend on the market.

Explained: Why Muthoot Finance shares fell over 8% todayMuthoot Finance stock price: Muthoot Finance, one of India's largest gold loan companies, has seen its share price decline by 14% in the past five trading sessions. The stock is also down 7% over the past month.

Mutual fund inflows hit in March. Trump tariffs to blame?The largest outflows were seen in debt mutual funds, where investors pulled out Rs 2.02 lakh crore, possibly due to end-of-year financial needs by institutions and ongoing global uncertainty.

Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath's money advice: 'No shortcuts to getting rich'Nithin Kamath shared a video with a powerful message—earning more doesn't mean you're saving more. In fact, higher income often leads to more spending on gadgets, clothes, dining out, or things meant just to impress others.

Trump tariffs, trade war fears could bring your loan EMIs down further this yearBorrowers could emerge as the unexpected winners if global headwinds linger and domestic growth slows further, with the RBI likely to step in again to lower the key interest rates.

Wall Street crashes, Dalal Street rallies: 5 things investors should knowStock market today: Dalal Street's leading indices rallied sharply, defying a global sell-off sparked by Wall Street's overnight crash. Here are the key factors behind today's stock market rally.

Mutual fund inflows fall for March by Rs 4,221 crore, shows AMFI dataEquity mutual fund inflows dropped by Rs 4,221 crore in March, falling to Rs 25,082 crore from Rs 29,303 crore in February 2025, as per data released by the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI).

TCS shares fall after disappointing Q4. Check latest price targetsTCS share price: Despite a muted Q4, brokerages back TCS with revised targets, betting on deal wins, margin levers, and recovery prospects to drive medium-term gains.

Sensex jumps 1,400 points: 3 things to know about Dalal Street rallyShare market today: A surprise rally may have lit up the screens, but with volatility still lurking and trade risks unresolved, investors would do well to tread carefully through this temporary pocket of optimism.

Sensex up by 1,300 points, Nifty above 22,500 as markets cheer tariff pauseStock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex surged 1,353.59 points to 75,200.74, while the NSE Nifty 50 gained 443.70 points to 22,842.85 as of 9:43 am.

Stock market today: Will Sensex, Nifty open higher on 90-day pause on tariffs?Sensex, Nifty today: Early signs suggest a positive start. Gift Nifty futures were trading at 22,933.5 at 8:20 am, showing a 2.5% jump from Nifty 50's Wednesday close of 22,399.15.

TCS to delay salary hike? Check what top management said after Q4 resultsTCS reported a net profit of Rs 12,224 crore for the fourth quarter of FY25. This is a 1.7% drop compared to Rs 12,434 crore reported in the same quarter last year.

Stocks to watch on April 11: TCS, Accenture, Deloitte, Tata Steel, BHELKey stocks to watch in today's trade include shares of TCS, Accenture, Deloitte, Tata Steel, BHEL Sun Pharma, Bharti Hexacom due to various news developments and third quarter results.

China tops FDI Confidence Index for third consecutive year, India slips to 5thChina has reaffirmed its position as one of the world's leading FDI hubs in the top 10 for four years and number one emerging market for three years. Despite global tensions, investors remain optimistic, with India ranking 5th among emerging markets in 2025.

US stocks dive as euphoria on Wall Street reverts to fear about US-China trade warUS stocks declined on Thursday after making historic gains a day earlier amid tensions between Washington and Beijing over tariffs.

Trump's 26% additional tariffs on India suspended till July 9: White HouseOn April 2, US President Donald Trump slapped universal duties on about 60 countries exporting goods to America and additional steep levies on countries like India.

Will Dalal Street cash in on Trump's 90-day tariff timeout?The US President's unexpected decision to announce a 90-day pause on reciprocal tariffs—with China being the notable exception—has reignited global risk appetite.

Italy's Prada agrees to buy fashion rival Versace in nearly $1.4 billion dealThe price Prada has agreed to pay for Versace is a big discount to the roughly USD 2.15 billion including debt that Capri paid for Versace in 2018.

TCS Q4 Results: Profit falls 2% to Rs 12,224 crore, final dividend at Rs 30TCS ends FY25 with strong deal wins but earnings miss estimates, capping a tough year for the IT giant as macro headwinds and weak discretionary spending weigh on profit growth.

EPFO introduces face authentication for UAN generation. Know detailsNow, both employers and employees can generate a UAN by simply using facial recognition via the government's UMANG app. This is expected to solve common problems such as incorrect personal details or missing mobile numbers, which often delayed UAN generation.

Apple airlifts 600 tons of iPhones from India to dodge Trump's China tariffsThe devices were flown out of the Chennai airport in the southern state of Tamil Nadu, where Apple has been building up production through its manufacturing partners like Foxconn and Tata.

TCS Q4 results to be announced today: What to expect from the IT firm?Investors and market watchers are expecting a mixed performance from the IT major. Key focus areas include operating margins, revenue growth, deal wins, employee attrition, and management commentary on guidance for the year ahead.

Sanjeev Sanyal says tariff-hit NRI relatives calling to ask for paracetamol, iPhonesDonald Trump has hinted at imposing new tariffs on pharmaceuticals, a move that could raise costs for Indian pharmaceutical companies. This would make Indian-made generic drugs more expensive for both Americans and Indian consumers.

90 days, $500 billion, one big shot: India's trade gamble in Trump's tariff pauseThe pause in tariffs is seen in New Delhi as more than just goodwill; it's strategic. By sparing countries like India, the US appears to be isolating China in what is shaping up to be the most aggressive round of trade hostilities since the Covid-19 pandemic.

Explained: What US-China trade war means for India and the worldWith tariffs flying thick and fast, supply chains unravelling, and geopolitical tensions rising, India, like much of the world, finds itself watching, waiting, and bracing for impact.

Bitcoin jumps over 6% after Trump's 90-day tariff break; Ethereum, XRP rallyBitcoin, along with other major cryptos like Ethereum, XRP, Cardano, Solana, and Dogecoin, etc., are witnessing a surge in their prices post US President Donald Trump's announcement of a 90-day pause on new tariff hikes.

Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath on market crash: 'Investors may stay away for years'In 2008, the global market took a major hit with the collapse of Lehman Brothers, a global financial services firm and one of the largest investment banks in the US, causing a ripple effect around the world.

Should stock market investors take Donald Trump's 'buy' tip seriously?From aggressive tariffs on China to sudden pauses and vague reassurances, the whiplash is real and investors are feeling it. Markets bleed one day and bounce back the next, all thanks to a tweet or a policy pivot from the US President.

RBI is cutting key rates, but are banks passing them on?RBI announced a cut in the repo rate by 25 basis points, bringing it down to 6% on Wednesday. The decision was made after the central bank's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC), led by Governor Sanjay Malhotra, finished its three-day meeting which started on April 7.

China's Yuan falls to 17-year low after Trump tariffs kick inThe decline in Yuan comes as a trade war between the world's two largest economies escalates. US President Donald Trump's "reciprocal" tariffs on dozens of countries took effect on Wednesday, including massive 104% duties on Chinese goods.

Global markets jump as Donald Trump hits pause on tariffsGlobal markets rise: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq saw their biggest daily percentage rises in over 10 years, adding over $1.5 trillion in market value.

Mahavir Jayanti holiday: Are Sensex and Nifty open for trading today?Stock market holiday: According to the official stock market holiday list, Mahavir Jayanti is one of three holidays in April. The other two are on April 14 for Dr Baba Saheb Ambedkar Jayanti and April 18 for Good Friday.

World's biggest green cargo ship, MSC Turkiye docks at Adani's Vizhinjam PortMSC Turkiye: The vessel is 399.9 metres long, 61.3 metres wide, and has a depth of 33.5 metres. It has the capacity to carry 24,346 twenty-foot equivalent units (TEUs), making it one of the largest container ships ever built.

Wall Street surges as Trump hits pause on tariffs, Dow jumps over 2,300 pointsWall Street jumped after President Trump paused new tariffs for 90 days, easing trade worries. Big tech companies like Apple and Nvidia led the gains.
Sensex falls over 350 points, Nifty below 22,500; banking stocks downThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 379.73 points to close at 73,847.15, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 136.70 points to end at 22,399.15.
From Rajdhani to Vande Bharat: Investor criticises India's lag in train techWhen Rajdhani was launched in 1969, it placed India among Asia's fastest rail nations, second only to Japan.

Singer Kumar Shanu's daughter Shannon K to perform at Coachella 2025Singer Kumar Shanu's daughter Shannon K is set to make her Coachella 2025 debut. The singer will be the first indie Indian-origin singer to perform at the global event.

From K-idol to screen icon, a spotlight on IU's illustrious careerKorean icon IU is both an accomplished actor and a K-pop star. The artiste is currently seen in Netflix's When Life Gives You Tangerines.

Viral: Superstar Rajinikanth arrives in Kerala for Jailer 2 shootSuperstar Rajinikanth arrived in Kerala's Attappadi to take part in the shooting of 'Jailer 2'. Directed by Nelson Dilipkumar, the current shooting schedule is expected to go on for about 20 days.

Priyanka Chopra reunites with Hrithik Roshan for Krrish 4: ReportPriyanka Chopra is reportedly believed to have joined forces with Hrithik Roshan again for Krrish 4. The next part of the franchise will be directed by Hrithik.

Nushrratt Bharuccha meets PM Modi, thanks him for rescuing her from IsraelNushrratt Bharuccha shared a post and thanked Prime Minister Narendra Modi for bringing her back from war-torn Israel during the recent conflicts. This comes after the actor met PM Modi at a recent event.

Empuraan box office: Mohanlal, Prithviraj's film storms past Rs 100 crore in IndiaMohanlal and Prithviraj Sukumaran's L2: Empuraan zoomed past Rs 100 crore at the domestic box office. On Day 15, the film witnessed a decline, earning only Rs 0.70 crore.

Sushmita Sen's sister-in-law Charu leaves Mumbai, is now selling clothes onlineSushmita Sen's ex sister-in-law, Charu Asopa, leaves Mumbai after facing a financial crisis. The actor even sold off her clothes online for extra money.

Indian, not pan-Indian: Sunny Deol on evolution of Indian cinemaJaat star Sunny Deol has been busy promoting his new film. During a recent media event, the actor spoke about the growing trend of pan-Indian films.

Emraan Hashmi on his son's cancer diagnosis: My entire world flipped in 12 hoursActor Emraan Hashmi recounted the harrowing day his son, Ayaan, was diagnosed with cancer. The life-changing event occurred unexpectedly during a family brunch in 2014.
Emraan Hashmi on singer KK: No substitute for certain talentActor Emraan Hashmi recently remembered the late singer KK and said that his voice was godsent. KK died in May in 2022.

general news.headline: No deal at gunpoint, India First approach: Piyush Goyal on trade talks with USMinister Piyush Goyal emphasised that India and the US are progressing on a bilateral trade agreement, aiming to double trade to USD 500 billion by 2030.
Waqf protest turns violent in Bengal: Mob throws stones at train, cops injuredAt least two trains have been cancelled, and another five have been diverted in the wake of the incident.

Vanishing Daughters, Part 3: Being a decoy in a Beti Bachao Beti Padhao raidA journalist-turned-decoy narrates harrowing sting operation exposing India's illegal sex determination industry, where doctors moonlight as law enforcers, informers risk everything, and bureaucratic turf wars often let the culprits slip through the cracks.

BJP, AIADMK to fight 2026 Tamil Nadu polls under EPS's leadership: Amit ShahUnion Home Minister Amit Shah confirmed AIADMK and BJP will jointly contest the 2026 Tamil Nadu Assembly elections. He announced that the alliance will be led by Edappadi K Palaniswami in Tamil Nadu and Prime Minister Narendra Modi nationally.

India's first extradition battle: When a daughter forgave her father's killerIndia's first extradition battle to get custody of Khalistani separatist Ranjit Singh 'Kuki' Gill lasted 12 years. Gill was among the three who killed Congress MP Lalit Maken, his wife and bodyguard in Delhi in 1985. Gill, extradited in 2000, walked free in 2009, after their daughter, Avantika Maken, forgave him for the murders.

US judge allows Mahmoud Khalil's deportation, cites national security riskMahmoud Khalil, a legal US resident, was taken into custody and flown to an immigration detention facility in Jena, Louisiana, far from his legal team and his wife.
Strong dust storms in Delhi, 15 flights diverted, one killed in wall collapseStrong dust winds and thick clouds swept through Delhi on Friday evening, prompting the IMD to issue a red alert.

US Vice President JD Vance likely to visit India between April 21-24US Vice President JD Vance and US National Security Advisor Mike Waltz will visit India from April 21-24, with key meetings and trade talks expected. Usha Vance will accompany him on her first visit to India as Second Lady.

Jet carrying Tahawwur Rana avoided Pak airspace, but flew over it on way backThe chartered business jet, however, took the usual route over Pakistan during its return to the UAE. On Thursday, it avoided Pakistani airspace while transporting Tahawwur Rana.

FIR against three in Punjab after India Today expose on sex determination racketPunjab Police registered an FIR against three individuals after an operation, in which India Today played a key role, caught them running an illegal sex determination facility.

Who was Sir C Sankaran Nair, the 'forgotten patriot' played by Akshay Kumar?Sir C Sankaran Nair, a civil rights advocate from the time of Indian freedom movement, will be played by Akshay Kumar on the big screen. Sankaran Nair was not just a fiery nationalist and civil rights advocate, he was also a former Indian National Congress president who was a forgotten hero, up until now.

Sony went global - but it all began in a Tokyo radio repair shop. Meet Masaru IbukaYears before Sony was a common name, Masaru Ibuka was just an amateur tinkerer student at Waseda University who liked to fix things and build things. From creating speakers to experimenting with light-wave communication, his early life was proof of the power of dedication and passion that can create far-reaching changes.

India's EVMs secure: Poll body sources after Tulsi Gabbard's tampering remarksThe Election Commission has reaffirmed that India's Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs), which are not connected to the Internet, are secure and have withstood legal and political scrutiny.
Kia Syros achieves 5-star safety rating at Bharat NCAPKia Syros is the most feature-loaded sub-4 metre compact SUV in India.

Georgia introduces Bill to recognise Hinduphobia, in a first for USGeorgia has become the first US state to introduce a bill recognising Hinduphobia amid an increase in Hindu-hate cases. If passed, it will update Georgia's penal code and enable law enforcement agencies to consider Hinduphobia while cataloguing discrimination and taking appropriate action.

India among list of countries bidding to host AFC Asian Cup 2031India have officially submitted a bid to host the 2031 AFC Asian Cup, aiming to bring a major football tournament back to the country for the first time since the 2017 FIFA U-17 World Cup.

CSK vs KKR Highlights: All-round Kolkata hammer Chennai by 8 wicketsChennai Super Kings (CSK) vs Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) Highlights, IPL 2025: The Knight Riders beat the Super Kings by 8 wickets at the MA Chidambaram Stadium after chasing down 104 with 59 balls to spare.

Priyansh Arya reveals sole regret from heroic hundred vs CSKPriyansh Arya hit a terrific hundred vs CSK in the IPL 2025. After the dust settled on the PBKS vs CSK game, Priyansh spoke about his only regret from the game.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
